availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Benjamin H. Perry Jr. (Henry County, Kentucky, farmer.)

body.p: Henry County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Son of Benjamin H. Perry and Jemima Perry. Resident of Henry County, Kentucky, in 1850. Household owned seventeen enslaved people in Henry County in 1850. Farmer in Henry County in 1860. Owned sixteen enslaved people in Henry County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Henry County, District 1, p. 381A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Henry County, District 1.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Henry County, District 1, p. 253.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Henry County, District 1, p. 17.
"Benjamin Head Perry Jr. (1813-1885)," Find A Grave, Memorial 8169280, accessed October 6, 2022, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/8169280.
"Jemima Stewart Perry (1779-1834)," Find A Grave, Memorial 8169336, accessed October 6, 2022, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/8169336.
